The river Nuenna runs through the village, which is an important tributary of the river Nore. The Slieveardagh Hills are to the southeast.

There was a monastery built here in the 7th century.
Buses stop in front of the community Hall.

value: : These buses leave Kilkenny(Parade) at 12:00 & 17:30. They drive to Freshford, then Johnstown and Urlingford.

You are advised to ask the driver if the bus is going to Freshford as the buses don't have destinations marked on them.

Two bus companies offer these services:
Freshford is very small and easy to walk around.

value: A detail from the portal of St Lachtain's Church

content=n the centre of Freshford sits St. Lachtain's Church. The present church dates from 1731, but there are remains of older churches incorporated in it.
The first church on this site was built after 622AD, the year St. Lachtain dies. It was burnt by the Vikings in the 9th century after they robbed it. It was rebuild in the 1100's. The sandstone Romanesque portal, at the main entrances, dates from this time. It is a national monument, and one of only two in Ireland.
content=In 1225, a bishop's palace was built on the site of Uppercourt Manor. But in 1553, the bishop fled after five of his servants were murdered. The present building dates from 1790.

content=The remains of a cross stands in the village green. It was made of sandstone and has been worn away by the weather. It was originally erected behind Uppercourt Manor in 1622, in memory of Lucas Shee. In 1790, it was moved to its present location.
directions=About 1 1/2km from Freshford, up a winding road. On private land, but easy to get to.
content=Built in 1350. The abbey is small in size but contains a wealth of splendid Gothic carvings and architectural features. There is also a perfect sedilia.

content=Every year, the Irish Conker Championships take place in Freshford. The next computation will be held on the 24th Oct 2010. Fresh conkers are provided. There is also fresh food, crafts, art and events to keep the kids busy.
directions=Less than 1 km from the village
content=A 2 km walk through a woodland.
content=Moate Farm offers all guests a special Irish farm experience where home baking, a friendly, farm family atmosphere and peaceful stay are guaranteed. Open: 1 Mar-30 Oct.
content=A B&B on a small stud.
content=A B&B on a beef farm.
- The capital of County Kilkenny is only 14km away. It's famous for it medieval history.

Urlingford, Johnstown and Thurles  in the north west of the County.

value: - a small town near Freshford, really off the tourist trail.
- The main town in north Kilkenny. Coal was mined here for over 300 years. Visit Castlecomer Discover Park and Footprints in Coal Experience to learn more.
